obstacle_course_seed123.description: Complete the obstacle course by navigating over, pushing, kicking, and jumping on objects.

Navigate_and_Jump_Over_LowWall.description: Approach the low wall and jump over it to the other side.

walk_to_lowWall.description: The robot should walk until it is positioned directly in front of the low wall, ready to initiate a jump. The goal state is the robot being stable and within optimal jumping distance of the low wall.

jump_over_lowWall.description: The robot should perform a jump action to clear the low wall, landing on the opposite side. The goal state is the robot having successfully cleared the low wall and landed on the other side, potentially in an unstable state.

stabilize_after_jump.description: The robot should regain its balance after landing from the jump. The goal state is the robot being in a stable, standing position on the far side of the low wall, ready for the next task.

Push_LargeSphere_Into_HighWall.description: Locate the large sphere, approach it, and push it into the high wall to knock the wall over.

walk_to_largeSphere.description: The robot should walk until it is positioned near the large sphere, ready to interact with it. The goal state is the robot being stable and within pushing distance of the large sphere.

push_largeSphere_into_highWall.description: The robot should apply force to the large sphere, pushing it directly towards the high wall until the sphere collides with and pushes over the high wall. The goal state is the large sphere having moved and the high wall having fallen over.

Kick_SmallSphere_Away_From_Wall.description: Approach the small sphere and kick it away from its current position.

walk_to_smallSphere.description: The robot should walk until it is positioned near the small sphere, ready to interact with it. The goal state is the robot being stable and within kicking distance of the small sphere.

kick_smallSphere_away_from_wall.description: The robot should perform a kicking motion to propel the small sphere away from its current position near the wall. The goal state is the small sphere having moved a significant distance away from its original location.

Navigate_and_Jump_On_BlockCube.description: Approach the block cube and jump on top of it.

walk_to_blockCube.description: The robot should walk until it is positioned directly in front of the block cube, ready to jump onto it. The goal state is the robot being stable and within optimal jumping distance of the block cube.

jump_on_top_of_blockCube.description: The robot should perform a jump action to land on top of the block cube. The goal state is the robot being stable and standing on the top surface of the block cube.

obstacle_course_seed123.description:
Environment set-up description: The environment should have five objects in it. A wide low wall, 5m in the y-axis and 0.5m in the z and 0.3m in x axis. A large sphere 1m radius. A wide high wall, 5m in the y axis 1m in the z axis and 0.3m in the x axis. A small sphere 0.2m radius. and a block cube of 0.5m cubed. These objects should be positioned along the x axis in a line, with 3m separating each. The order should be: 1) Low wall, 2) large sphere, 3) high wall, 4) small sphere and 5) block. The robot will start at 0,0,0 and the first object (low wall) should be 3m away in the x axis. Such that the robot meets each object sequentially like an obstacle course.  
        
        Robot task description: The robot should first walk to the low wall and then jump over it, then the robot should push the large sphere into the high wall. The sphere hitting the high wall should push it over. The robot should then walk to a small sphere and kick it away from the wall. Finally the robot should walk to a 0.5x0.5x0.5 block and jump on top of it.
